Talk_0087:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughS_01>As of today, you and me are pals.
And because we're pals, I'm gonna let
you help me.
Now that that's decided, I'm going to
briefly go over everything on our
to-do list.
<sp:3:0:2:0001>First, we're going to rebuild each
destroyed building's foundation.

<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Think_01>So let's see...<sp:5:1:0>yeah...<sp:5:1:0><sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701>Think you can collect <clr:0000><sp:2:e:46:400055006f0074006f00720069005f0052006500760069007600650050006c0061006e005f00520065007100750065007300740057006f006f0064004e0075006d00ffff00cd> logs<clr:ffff> for me?
That's what we'll need.<sp:5:0:0> And when I say
"logs," I don't mean ones from palm trees.<sp:0:4:0>I'm going to use those palm trees for
something important. So get those <clr:0000>logs<clr:ffff>
from other trees, OK?
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Trouble_00>Also, I'm gonna need <clr:0000><sp:2:e:48:420055006f0074006f00720069005f0052006500760069007600650050006c0061006e005f005200650071007500650073007400530074007200610077004e0075006d00ffff00cd> <sp:c9:6:20:0c00620075006e0064006c0065000e00620075006e0064006c00650073000000> of
Hylian rice<clr:ffff> to repair the thatched roofs
that were burned.
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Think you can handle that too?
Talk_0192:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Greeting_00>Of all the dishes we serve at our
restaurant, this is the one I'm most
proud of.
Please stop by anytime you're hungry.<sp:0:4:0>I'll treat you to meals the likes of which
you've never tasted before!
Talk_0088:
<sp:3:0:2:0801>Our first collaboration! How exciting is
that? Heh, no pressure or anything, but
I'll be counting on you!
Talk_0193:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:Happy_01>Hoo! <sp:5:0:0>It's PERFECT! I couldn't have found
a better pillar to hold this place up myself.
Talk_0089:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>I'm gonna call this project...<sp:5:1:0>"the Great
Lurelin Village Revival"!
Talk_0031:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughL_01>Incredible! How can I ever thank you?
And to think, you restored the village so
quickly...
A feast is most certainly in order tonight!
Talk_0195:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:LaughS_00>I brought this back as a little treat
for everyone.
Talk_0033:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00><snd:Sad_00>We have to do something about the state
of the village, or no one will return home.
Talk_0196:
The work I did here, it's just my way of
paying that kindness back.
Talk_0034:
<sp:3:0:2:0b01><snd:Happy_00>Whaa! Wh-what is going on?! I thought
the pirates destroyed my place!

But here it is, good as new!
Talk_0197:
So from now on, we'll do everything we
can to share our hospitality with you.
Talk_0035:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_01>You two rebuilt it, didn't you?


I was hiding out in the Gerudo region
in the southwest, but it's just sand as
far as the eye can see.
I missed the ocean so much, I had to
come back. And then I found this! I can't
believe my inn is all fixed up!
I'm stunned!


<snd:TalkPositive_00>Ah, I'm sorry. <sp:5:1:0>I really must give you a
thank-you gift!
Talk_0140:
<snd:TalkPositive_00>This moment right now...it's all thanks
to you.
Talk_0036:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_00>Restored to its former glory! Some of my
finest work, if I do say so myself.

The owner can move back in any ol' time.
Talk_0141:
<snd:Understand_01>But the treasure we DO have...well,
it's this village and everyone in it.
Talk_0037:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_00>Well, well, well. You got right to work
gathering logs, I see! May I?
Talk_0142:
Before I knew it, our beloved home
was...gone.
Talk_0143:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting_00>We're gonna start by rebuilding the
foundation of each of the buildings the
monsters destroyed.
See, when a building's central pillar is
busted, you have to shore up the
foundation or it'll all come crashing down.
Talk_0038:
<sp:3:0:2:0401><snd:SurpriseS_01>So, you're gonna dangle something
I want right in front of my nose, and
then...<sp:5:0:0>what...<sp:5:0:0>just take it away?!
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Ordinarily, I wouldn't mind playing
around, but I've got things to do!
Talk_0144:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:TalkPositive_00>OK, so as far as <clr:0000>logs <clr:ffff>go, I need <clr:0000><sp:2:e:54:4e0055006f0074006f00720069005f0052006500760069007600650050006c0061006e005f0047006500740057006f006f00640043006f0075006e0074005f00520065006d00610069006e0065006400ffff00cd><clr:ffff> more.
Think you can handle that?

And when I say "logs," I don't mean the
kind that come from palm trees.<sp:0:4:0>I've got plans for those palm trees, OK?
So make sure our <clr:0000>logs <clr:ffff>come from other
kinds of trees.
Talk_0039: <sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Understand_00>♪Okey-doo!♪ I'll take good care of that.
Talk_0146:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Understand_00>We're gonna restore these charming
buildings to their former glory,
♪you and me, baby!♪
Talk_0147:
<sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:Understand_01>Let's move over to the <clr:0000>inn<clr:ffff> so I can
do a better job explaining what we
need to do, OK?
Talk_0148:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:TalkPositive_01>First thing I've got to do is use those logs
you collected to shore up the foundations
under the buildings.
So hold tight for just a bit, OK?<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0801>I'll do the foundation work and check the
state of the buildings while I'm at it.
♪I'll be back before you know it!♪
Talk_0050:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughS_01>I usually save them for the people here in
the village. But I really owe you for fixing
my house.
If I have extras to share, I'll put them in
front of my house. Please, take whatever
you need.
Talk_0051:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:Admiration_01>Now I can go fishing again!<sp:0:4:0>You know, I don't need very many fish to
feed myself, so I share the extras I catch
with other folks.
Talk_0201:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughS_01>Right now they're shadows of their
former selves, but once upon a time these
buildings were BURSTING with charm!
<sp:3:0:2:0001>There's the <clr:0000>inn<clr:ffff>, famous for its salt spa
and herb treatment that's said to soothe
the sore muscles of weary travelers.
There's the <clr:0000>restaurant<clr:ffff>—Azure Bay—
where visitors enjoy cuisine from all
over the world.
And there's the <clr:0000>Lucky Treasure Shop<clr:ffff>,
known for entrancing travelers with a
treasure game that has no losers.
There's also the <clr:0000>village head's house<clr:ffff>,
where I happen to live, and <clr:0000>Armes's
house<clr:ffff>...and that's about it.
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:Understand_00>So look lively! We gotta rebuild this
place and QUICK. It's time to put the
charm back in this charming village!
Talk_0052:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughS_01>It's aaaaaall <sp:5:1:0>done!


From here on out, I'll have a comfy place
to sleep at night.
Talk_0053:
<sp:3:0:2:0801>There was a picture from Princess Zelda
on display in the detached hut.

Quick, let's make sure it's not damaged!
Talk_0054:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_01>Get a load of my handiwork! Talk about a
perfect restoration job. The ol' building
skills are still sharp as nails, baby!
Now all we have to do is wait for the
owner to return, and—
Talk_0160:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:SurpriseS_01>Whoa, whoa, whoa! What, exactly, is goin'
on here?

I was sure the monsters had done my
shop in!
Talk_0056:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:TalkPositive_01>I just came to check on my restaurant and
my house. I was so worried about them.
Was...was it you? Did you fix them?
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_01>Thank you so much! Please, I want you to
have this.
Talk_0161:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_01>I heard the pirates were gone and
came running.

I can't believe I can open my shop again.
I never thought this day would come!

<snd:Happy_00>This place means everything to me.
My old man...rest his soul...left it to me.

Here, please, I have to thank you.
Take this.
Talk_0206:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:LaughS_01>If we can get that central pillar into place,
then I can get started on the rest of the
repairs right away.
<sp:3:0:2:0801>Keep it up, pal. <sp:5:1:0>♪We're almost there!♪
Talk_0057:
<snd:CallFar_01>As of now, <sp:5:0:0>Azure Bay is open
for business!
Talk_0162:
<sp:3:0:2:0801>Because of you, the Lucky Treasure Shop
is back in business!

<snd:LaughL_00>In fact, you don't even need rupees! You 
can be broke and still come on in and try
your luck. Doors are open startin' now!
Talk_0207: <sp:3:0:2:0701>Just leave the rest to me. I'm on it!
Talk_0163:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_00>Hey, HEY. This is no time for resting on
laurels. There's work to do and it ain't
doing itself.
Look, you and me—we're BEASTS of
construction! We'll have this village
put back together in no time.
Talk_0058:
<sp:3:0:2:0801>Please, come on by and enjoy our famous
salt spa.

No time to waste—the inn is open for
business as of today!
Talk_0001:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:LaughS_01>The way you fought those pirates...
It was incredible! Awe-inspiring!

And now that you've driven them out,
it's my turn to get to work.
Talk_0164:
<sp:3:0:2:0001>It's known far and wide for its salt spa. 
They use herbs and whatnot to soothe
travelers' sore and weary muscles.
Talk_0208:
<sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:Understand_01>How about we relocate to the <clr:0000>restaurant<clr:ffff>
so I can do a better job explaining the
work we need to do?
Talk_0059:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Happy_01>Sorry you had to go to the trouble of
fixing up our house. Here, I'd like to give
you something for the repairs.
Talk_0002:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:SurpriseS_01>What did you say?! <sp:5:1:0>No, I appreciate the
offer, but...

You've already done so much. You drove
off those awful pirates, after all!

I couldn't ask an outsider to go to so
much trouble for us.
Talk_0209:
<sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:Understand_01>How 'bout we head to the Lucky Treasure
Shop so I can explain what we need
to do to fix that baby up?
Talk_0003:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Understand_00>Now, now, if he's offering to help, who
are we to say no?
Talk_0166:
<sp:3:0:2:0001>Azure Bay is known for its incredible
cuisine, you know. They offer dishes from
all over the world.
Talk_0167:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:Trouble_00>The central pillar is broken, and we have
to fix it, pronto.

After all, it provides vital support to the
whole building.<sp:0:4:0>I already used the logs you collected to
shore up the foundation, so...
Talk_0168: <sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive>The Lucky Treasure Shop is over there.
Talk_0110:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>We'll need to stick a <clr:0000>palm-tree log<clr:ffff>
through the detached hut too.

There are even holes for a central pillar
in the <clr:0000>roof<clr:ffff> and <clr:0000>floor<clr:ffff>. That's where the log
is supposed to go.
Talk_0169:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:QuestionNormal>What are you saying?<sp:5:1:0> Everything else has
been rebuilt. We're so close.
Talk_0111:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Think_01>Of course, there are plenty of <clr:0000>logs to
be had from the palm trees <clr:ffff>growing
around here.
But how are we gonna put one of those
logs through the <clr:0000>holes in the floor and
the roof<clr:ffff>?
You might say it's a real stumper.
Talk_0007:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Understand_00>If we restore the houses, the villagers
who fled are sure to come flocking back—
I just know it.
We've come too far to turn back now!
We're gonna rebuild Lurelin Village with
our own four hands!
Talk_0113:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_00>Luckily, the house's main building went
undamaged, but the detached hut where
Bolson is staying was destroyed.
I was so worried about finding a place for
him to sleep...but not anymore!
Talk_0009:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughL_00>Are you planning on doing all that work
while wearing...so little? Unconventional,
sure, but I admire your carefree spirit.
Talk_0070:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Admiration_01>Now, I talked about this with the rest of
the folks around here...

and we do not have enough money or
treasure to repay you for saving our
home.
Talk_0220:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Trouble_00>If we're gonna get this place looking
good as new, we gotta replace the
central pillar with a palm-tree lo—<sp:5:1:0>
<sp:3:0:2:0b01>No way! <sp:5:1:0>When did that log get put there?!
Talk_0071:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_01>Please, feel free to take anything you
find in the village.
Talk_0072:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:LaughS>Seeing someone work so hard—and in the
rain even—it warms my heart!

Thank you. I'll be sure to take good care
of this.
Talk_0221:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Trouble_00>If we're gonna repair Armes's house,
we've gotta replace the central pillar
with a palm-tree log—<sp:5:1:0>
<sp:3:0:2:0b01>Hey now! <sp:5:1:0>How long has that log been
sticking through there?!
Talk_0073:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:LaughS>Seeing someone work so hard—and on so
little sleep—it warms my heart!

Thank you. I'll be sure to take good care
of this.
Talk_0222:
<sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:TalkPositive_01>As you can see, the frame and the central
pillar managed to hold up just fine.

Buuut...<sp:5:0:0>if you look inside, you'll see
there's a puddle of rainwater.

Getting rid of the water won't be difficult,
but that junk in there is a hazard and will
make it impossible for me to work.
<sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:Think_01>I don't want to damage the framing,
since we're lucky it's intact. But I'm not
sure how to <clr:0000>get rid of that debris<clr:ffff>.
It won't be easy, but I think we're gonna
have to pull it out piece by piece
<clr:0000>from above<clr:ffff>.
Talk_0117:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>We're gonna need to stick a <clr:0000>palm-tree log<clr:ffff>
through Armes's house as well.

There are even holes for the central
pillar in the <clr:0000>roof<clr:ffff> and <clr:0000>floor <clr:ffff>right where
the palm-tree log should go through.
Talk_0074:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Think_01>Very few of us are able to stay in the
village. We must find someone to help us.
Talk_0223:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughS_01>Once all that junk is gone, I'll start the
rebuilding work right away. It will look
♪incredible!♪
Talk_0118:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Think_01>Sure, we can get a <clr:0000>palm-tree log<clr:ffff> from the
palm trees growing nearby.

But how are we going to insert it into the
<clr:0000>holes in the roof and the floor<clr:ffff>?

Quite the quagmire, isn't it?
Talk_0075:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:LaughS_00>Now that the pirates are gone, even the
air itself feels clean again.

Truly, I can't thank you enough.
Talk_0224:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:QuestionNormal_00>Well, well. <sp:5:1:0>I'm betting someone got rid
of all that junk. That someone is you,
by the way.
Talk_0180:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:LaughS_00>I picked several of them while I was
hiding out.

I was planning to throw them at
the pirates. But there's no need for
that now!
Talk_0076:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Trouble_00>You can leave all the rebuilding to me.


Though coming up with the materials...
That's gonna be an issue. See, I'll need
<clr:0000>Hylian rice<clr:ffff> and lots of <clr:0000>logs<clr:ffff>.
And the thing is, I want to use the palm
trees around here as central pillars, so the
logs gotta come from somewhere else.
Talk_0226:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:LaughS_00>The foundations are nice 'n' solid!
Now it's time to move on to repairing
the buildings.
Talk_0078:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Happy_01>Thank you...<sp:5:1:0>for everything.


I won't be able to assist you myself.
I'll be looking around and assessing
the damage.
Talk_0183:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Think_00>You know, sometimes <clr:0000>Hylian rice<clr:ffff> will
turn up if you cut the grass...even
around here.
But it might be faster to buy it in my old
hometown of <clr:0000>Hateno Village<clr:ffff>.
Talk_0227:
<sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:Trouble_00>The central pillar is broken, so we have
to repair it, pronto.

I already shored up the building's
foundation using the logs you collected
for me.
So if we can <clr:0000>place a log from a palm tree
through <clr:ffff>the holes in the <clr:0000>roof <clr:ffff>and<clr:0000> floor<clr:ffff>
like I mentioned, that should do it.
Talk_0021:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:TalkPositive>An establishment it is! Which one should
we get to work on?
Talk_0228:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:Trouble_00>A palm tree grew through the roof,
up on the second story.

It was a bit of a landmark actually. But,
well, the damage is worse than I thought.

I rebuilt the foundation using the logs
you collected for me.

<snd:Understand_01>But this building is so big that rather than
connecting the roof and floor...

the <clr:0000>palm-tree log<clr:ffff> should go in the <clr:0000>plant
pot<clr:ffff> on the second floor and then up
through the hole in the <clr:0000>roof<clr:ffff>.
Talk_0022:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:TalkPositive>We're rebuilding a house are we?
Well, which house is the lucky one?
Talk_0229:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:Understand_00>When it comes to selecting a good
<clr:0000>palm-tree log<clr:ffff>, make sure you get
yourself a <clr:0000>straight<clr:ffff> one, OK?
<sp:3:0:2:0801>You and me, let's return these places
♪to their former glory!♪
Talk_0185:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Understand_01>To fix up Armes's house, we have
to replace the central pillar with a
<clr:0000>palm-tree log<clr:ffff>.
But you have to be careful to pick a log
that's suuuper <clr:0000>straight<clr:ffff>, or it won't go
through the <clr:0000>roof and floor holes<clr:ffff>.
Talk_0023:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:TalkPositive>Hey, it's OK to not rush this decision...
but what do ya think? Which building
gets our love and attention?
Talk_0024:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Understand_00>Don't you worry. I might not look it, but I
know a thing or two about construction.

Besides, I owe you—no, I owe this whole
village—for taking me in.

And I pay my debts. It's kinda my thing.


<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Understand_01>Also, this village has ♪chaaarm.♪ I can't
wait to restore the restaurant and the
Lucky Treasure Shop to their former glory.
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Think_00>Hmm. Materials might be an issue though.
<sp:5:1:0>See, I'm gonna need a rather large
amount of <clr:0000>logs <clr:ffff>and <clr:0000>Hylian rice<clr:ffff>...
And since I want to use the palm trees
as central pillars in the buildings, the logs
have to come from somewhere else.
Talk_0130:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:Happy_01>Now we're getting to the real meat of the
Great Lurelin Village Revival. So...<sp:5:1:0>which
building should we get to work on?
Talk_0188:
I'd live to see the day we could all laugh
together again like this.
Talk_0131:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:Happy_00>This is my first big job in a while, and
I admit I'm absolutely thrilled to be
getting back at it!
Now...<sp:5:1:0>which building should we work
some magic on?
Talk_0189:
<sp:3:0:2:0001>I already explained what we need to do,
so how 'bout we head to the site and
get started?
Talk_0027:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Think_00>Yes. The pirates may be gone, but that
doesn't mean we can roll out the welcome
mat yet.
Talk_0090:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Humming_00>♪Bolson! Da-da-da-Bollllllson!
Hoo-WAH hoo-WAH!♪<sp:5:1:0>

<sp:3:0:2:0701>♪Bolson! Da-da-da-Bollllllson!
Sha-SHA sha-DING!♪<sp:5:1:0>
Talk_0091:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:LaughS>Seeing someone work so hard—and so
early in the morning—it warms my heart!

Thank you. I'll be sure to take good care
of this.
Talk_0093:
<sp:3:0:2:0b01><snd:Happy_01>Will you look at that!<sp:5:1:0> What a haul!<sp:5:1:0>
Thanks a lot, pal.
Talk_0139:
<snd:Think_01>After everyone fled, the only sound
coming from Lurelin Village was the
sound of monsters.
Talk_0040:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_00>Ah, look at you, already bringing in the
logs—<sp:5:1:0><sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:Trouble_00>Ohhh, I'm so sorry. <sp:5:1:0>This type of log
doesn't work well when it comes to
shoring up foundations.
<sp:3:0:2:0001>I spotted some better trees growing in the
hills not far from the village entrance.

You know, in the area where we were
hiding? You should take a look-see
around there.
Talk_0041:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:Trouble_00>Hold on a second. <sp:5:0:0>Sorry, yeah...<sp:0:4:0>Looks like you've got a type of log in here
that's no good for shoring up foundations.

<sp:3:0:2:0001>I feel just awful about it. I mean, you went
to all that trouble. Still, I can only take
the lumber I can use, you know?
Talk_0099:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:Think_01>Even though we can easily score a log
from a <clr:0000>palm tree<clr:ffff> growing nearby...

I don't have a CLUE how we're going to
insert that log through the <clr:0000>holes in the
roof and the floor<clr:ffff>.
I mean, we have to pick a palm tree that's
<clr:0000>straight<clr:ffff> as an arrow—that much I know.

<sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:Trouble_00>But the rest is a real head-scratcher.
Talk_0042:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:QuestionSurprise_00>Wait just one minute!<sp:0:4:0>I'm GUESSING you want me to add this
to our log collection? Sheesh. How about
a "Hi, how ya doing?" to go with it?
Don't get me wrong, I appreciate the
whole man-of-few-words thing, but c'mon!
I'm right here!
Anyhoo, I'll go ahead and add this to
the <clr:0000>stockpile<clr:ffff>.
Talk_0044:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:LaughS_01>Hahaha! Behold! What you see before you
is the work of a true craftsman!
Talk_0150:
<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:TalkPositive_01>If there's anything you want to ask me,
just fire away! That's what I'm here for.
Talk_0151:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:Happy_01>Whoa! You gathered those right quick,
didn't you! You move fas—<sp:5:1:0> Hold up.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0001>There's not enough here.<sp:0:4:0>I need <clr:0000><sp:2:e:48:420055006f0074006f00720069005f0052006500760069007600650050006c0061006e005f005200650071007500650073007400530074007200610077004e0075006d00ffff00cd> <sp:c9:6:20:0c00620075006e0064006c0065000e00620075006e0064006c00650073000000> of Hylian rice<clr:ffff> total.
It might be a little tough to find.

But I know you, and you're not the type
to give up at the first sign of adversity.
So keep at it!
Talk_0153:
<sp:3:0:2:0001>Three of them are establishments—
the inn,<sp:5:1:0> the restaurant, <sp:5:1:0>and the
Lucky Treasure Shop.
Talk_0154:
<sp:3:0:2:0001>And two of them are <clr:0000>homes<clr:ffff>—the village
head's house,<sp:5:1:0> and Armes's house.
Talk_0049:
<sp:3:0:2:0101>You really fixed it? Thank you! I can finally
get back to making a living.

I'm really sorry I wasn't any help. Please,
take this as a kind of apology.
Talk_0155:
<sp:3:0:2:0001>The repair process will depend on the
building we're working on. So I'll explain
once you decide where we start.
Talk_0157:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Think>If we're gonna repair the inn, we're gonna
have to figure out how to <clr:0000>remove the
debris <clr:ffff>in there.
Believe it or not, I think we gotta pull
each and every piece of junk out of
there <clr:0000>from above<clr:ffff>.
Talk_0158:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:QuestionNormal_01>You want to leave that one for later, eh?
So which building should we repair, then?
Talk_0159:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_01>Yesss! It's <sp:5:1:0>perrr-<sp:5:1:0>fec-<sp:5:1:0>to<sp:5:1:0>!


It's the biggest building in this village,
so returning it to its former glory wasn't
easy. But the owner is gonna LOVE it!
Talk_0104:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>What I'm thinking is we'll use a log from a
palm tree as the central pillar for the
Lucky Treasure Shop too.
But this building is big, so rather than
connect the roof and floor...

the <clr:0000>palm-tree log <clr:ffff>would go in the <clr:0000>plant
pot<clr:ffff> on the second floor and through the
hole in the <clr:0000>roof<clr:ffff>.
Talk_0060:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_00>Oooh! I thought I heard the sound of
hammering coming from the house.

It's exactly how it was before!
Talk_0061: <sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_00>Wow! But it was all broken before!
Talk_0210:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>This building is big, so rather than
connecting the roof and floor...

the <clr:0000>palm-tree log <clr:ffff>has to go into the <clr:0000>plant
pot<clr:ffff> on the second floor and then through
the hole in the <clr:0000>roof<clr:ffff>.
Talk_0105:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Think_01>It's easy enough to get a <clr:0000>palm-tree log<clr:ffff>
from the palm trees growing around here.

But how are we going to get the log into
the <clr:0000>plant pot and through the hole in
the roof<clr:ffff>?
It is quite the conundrum, is it not?
Talk_0062: <sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_00>Look, Zuta! Our house! It's all better too.
Talk_0211:
<sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:Understand_01>How 'bout we head over there so I can
explain what we need to do to fix the
place up?
Talk_0212:
<sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:Understand_01>Why don't we relocate to Armes's house
for a bit? It'll be easier for me to explain
what we need to do.
Talk_0064:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:TalkPositive>We fixed up all the establishments! Now,
time to move on to the houses. Which one
are you thinking?
Talk_0213:
<sp:3:0:2:0001>I'm betting you don't need me to keep
telling you how to do your job. So how
'bout we head straight to the site?
Talk_0065:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:TalkPositive>We fixed up all the houses! Now, time to
move on to the establishments. Which one
should we start with?
Talk_0214:
<sp:3:0:2:0001>I can't wait to return that baby to its
former glory! Whaddaya say? Should we
head over there and get to work?
Talk_0170:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Understand_00>To rebuild the restaurant, the first thing
we need to do is take a <clr:0000>log from a palm
tree <clr:ffff>and use it as the central pillar.
But careful there. You have to pick a log
that's <clr:0000>straight<clr:ffff>, or you won't be able to
line it up with the <clr:0000>roof and floor holes<clr:ffff>.
Talk_0171:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>If we can <clr:0000>use a log from a palm tree<clr:ffff>
to support this building the same way,
then we'll be set.
See the holes in the <clr:0000>roof <clr:ffff>and the<clr:0000> floor<clr:ffff>?<sp:5:1:0>
They're a perfect fit for a log. All we need
to do is put the log through them.
Talk_0067:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_00>You can get yourself some logs by cutting
down trees.

But watch out. Get carried away and cut
the logs...well, then you've got nothing
but wood, and that's no good.
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Trouble_00>I saw lots of gorgeous trees growing
around the hills near the village entrance.

Remember? Near the place we were
hiding out?

I admit, it's a bit of a hike. Sure would be
nice if there was some way to carry the
logs more easily.
Talk_0216:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:TalkPositive_01>As you can see, the central pillar is right
where it should be, but the inside is full of
debris—<sp:5:1:0>
<sp:3:0:2:0b01>Whoa, whoa! <sp:5:1:0>Where did all that debris and
junk that was in there go?
Talk_0217:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:LaughS_00>Let me guess... You had something to
do with this, didn't you? <sp:5:0:0>You know what
I love? I love a go-getter, that's what.
Talk_0010:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive>We're rebuilding the Lucky Treasure
Shop, are we?
Talk_0173:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:Trouble_00>Once upon a time, a palm tree grew up
through the building's second-story roof.

It used to be a bit of a landmark because
of that. But now...well, the damage is
worse than I thought.
There has to be a central pillar. It's a
crucial support for a building!<sp:0:4:0>I already used the logs you collected
to shore up the foundation.
Talk_0218:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Admiration_01>If we're gonna get the restaurant in
shape, we gotta replace the central pillar
with a <clr:0000>palm-tree log<clr:ffff>—<sp:5:1:0>
<sp:3:0:2:0b01>Whoa, WHOA! <sp:5:1:0>How long has that palm
tree been there?!
Talk_0011:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>It's a charming spot that beguiles
travelers with a treasure game that,
rumor has it, no one ever loses.
Talk_0174:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:Understand_00>When you pick a <clr:0000>palm-tree log<clr:ffff>, just make
sure it's a <clr:0000>straight<clr:ffff> one.

<sp:3:0:2:0801>You and me, pal, let's return these places
♪to their former glory!♪
Talk_0219:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Trouble_00>If we're gonna repair the Lucky Treasure
Shop, then we have to replace the central
pillar with a palm-tree log—<sp:5:1:0>
<sp:3:0:2:0b01>Whoa, WHOA! <sp:5:1:0>How long has that log
been sticking through there?!
Talk_0012:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive>Oooh, we're rebuilding the house for
the head of the village, are we?
Talk_0176:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Understand_01>If we're gonna repair the Lucky Treasure
Shop, we have to<clr:0000> stick a palm-tree log
through there<clr:ffff> to replace the central pillar.
Talk_0013:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>That there is where the village head and
his family live. They've been letting me
stay with them too.
<sp:3:0:2:0901>Ugh! It was so cozy. They even had a little
something from Princess Zelda on display.
Then along came those AWFUL monsters!
Talk_0177:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Understand_01>As far as repairs go, we need to replace
the central pillar with a <clr:0000>palm-tree log<clr:ffff>.

But you have to make sure you pick a log
that's <clr:0000>straight<clr:ffff> as an arrow, or it won't go
through the <clr:0000>roof and floor holes<clr:ffff>.
Talk_0015:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>I recall Armes said he wanted a spot
outside to display his biggest catches.
Talk_0120:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Of course, I am extremely grateful to
Bolson as well.
Talk_0179:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:LaughS_01>It's the tastiest fish you can catch around
here. Grill it, stew it, whatever you like...
It's always delicious.
Talk_0016:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:TalkPositive_00>You bet it is! Every last building in the
village is good as new.
Talk_0121:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_00>No, no. There's no need to thank me.
After all, when I first drifted into this
village...
you all welcomed me with open arms,
didn't you?
Talk_0017:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:QuestionSurprise_00>Did you hear that? A feast! He said a
FEAST is in order! Oh dear! You think
I should change my outfit?
Talk_0018:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Sad_00>The day the pirates attacked and overran
the village...I was desperate to get
everyone to safety.
Talk_0123:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Greeting_01>For the village's savior, I'll provide a bed
for <clr:0000>free<clr:ffff> anytime.
Talk_0080:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:Chat_01>The <clr:0000>inn<clr:ffff> is the only one that still
needs fixing.
Talk_0019:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>This village owes you a debt... In fact,
I think it's safe to say that you are this
village's <clr:0000>savior<clr:ffff>!
Talk_0124:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:TalkPositive_00>You are also welcome to eat at the
restaurant as much as you like, <clr:0000>free
of charge<clr:ffff>, of course.
Talk_0230:
<sp:3:0:2:0801>Now we have enough logs to make
the repairs. Time to start rebuilding
those buildings!
Talk_0081:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:Chat_01>The <clr:0000>Lucky Treasure Shop<clr:ffff> is the only one
that still needs fixing.
Talk_0082:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:Chat_01>The <clr:0000>restaurant<clr:ffff> is the only one that still
needs fixing.
Talk_0126:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting_00>The village's savior may not need to test
his luck, but I'm sure it'd be fun to <clr:0000>play
a treasure-chest game <clr:ffff>once in a while.
Talk_0083:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:Chat_01>The <clr:0000>village head's house<clr:ffff> is the only one
that still needs fixing.
Talk_0233:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Admiration>You are an inquisitive one, aren't you?
Or, hey, maybe you just like chatting
with your pal Bolson.
Talk_0084:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:Chat_01><clr:0000>Armes's house<clr:ffff> is the only one that still
needs fixing.
Talk_0190:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:Happy_01>Whoa! Just look at you go! ♪I like
the hustle!♪
Talk_0086:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Think_00>The monsters may be gone, but our work
isn't over yet.
